page.title: 01St. Martin and Trinity
page.content:
This block is predominantly rural i.e.farmland, isolated dwellings and hamlets. It contains the two parish centres of{St. Martin}and{Trinity,} each with its church, primary school, parish hall and pub. St. Martin is the more developed, with shops, a garage and many more houses spread out in a radial fashion along the main roads. The northern boundary is coastline with cliffs and sheltered bays such as{Bouley}and{Rozel.}
The main features of island interest in this area are the{Jersey Wildlife {Preservation Trust with its Zoo,}the { Orchid Farm}and the popular tourist centres of Rozel and Bouley Bay where the annual Hill Climb is held every Easter Monday. There are also several hotels and country guest houses in the area as well as the{Rozel Camp Site. }
